snippet: Last May, the newspaper’s owners, Advance Publications, announced it would cut back printing of The Times-Picayune and would make major cuts to the newsroom.
abstract: Times-Picayune of New Orleans says it plans to roll out a tabloid edition, nearly one year after the newspaper's owner, Advance Publications, announced that it would print only three days a week; Times-Picayune will continue to publish and offer home delivery of its traditional newspaper as well.
lead_paragraph: Last May, the newspaper’s owners, Advance Publications, announced it would cut back printing of The Times-Picayune and would make major cuts to the newsroom.

headline.main: Times-Picayune Plans a New Print Tabloid
headline.print_headline: Times-Picayune Plans a New Print Tabloid
